Utilities

Network Manager

$ systemctl enable NetworkManager.service
$ systemctl start NetworkManager.service
$ nm-applet

debug wpa_supplicant 

$ wpa_supplicant -i wlp2s0 -c /etc/wpa_supplicant/wpa_supplicant.conf -d

cpupower

display frequencies and governors 

$ cpupower frequency-info

set maximum frequency 

$ cpupower frequency-set -u 700MHz

pacman

Generate list of installed packages (excludes AUR)
# pacman -Qqn > packages_local.list
Generate list of manually installed packages (from AUR)
# pacman -Qqm > packages_aur.list
Download installed packages (excludes AUR)
# pacman -Sw $(cat packages_local.list)

-q option eliminates version numbers; i.e. lists only package names.

Backup dowloaded packages
$ tar -cjf pacman_pkg_downloads.tar.bz2 /var/cache/pacman/pkg
Backup local database
$ tar -cjf pacman_lib_local.tar.bz2 /var/lib/pacman/local
Restore archive
# tar -xjvf pacman_pkg_downloads.tar.bz2

Pacman tips and tricks

Mount squashfs

1. Create squashfs archive 

# mksquashfs /source_folder /archive.sqsh

2. Mount squashfs archive 

# mount archive.sqsh ./folder -t squashfs -o loop

3. fstab entry for squashfs 

/var/archive.sqsh	/var/archive	squashfs	ro,defaults	0 0

journalctld

1. To check amount of space used by journal 

#journalctl --disk-usage

2. Can delete folders/files under /var/log/journal folder
